translations.english: He granted five hundred jin of gold.

translations.chinese: 上還至雒陽，赦韓信，封為淮陰侯。
translations.english: The emperor returned to Luoyang, pardoned Han Xin, and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Huaiyin.

translations.chinese: 甲申，始剖符封功臣曹參等為通侯。
translations.english: On the day jiashen, he first divided tallies and enfeoffed meritorious ministers Cao Shen and others as noble marquises.

translations.chinese: 詔曰：「齊，古之建國也，今為郡縣，其復以為諸侯。
translations.english: The edict said: "Qi is an ancient established state. Now it is commanderies and counties. Restore it as feudal lords.

translations.chinese: 將軍劉賈數有 大功，及擇寬惠脩絜者，王齊、荊地。」
translations.english: General Liu Jia has repeatedly had great merit. Choose one who is lenient, benevolent, and pure to be king of Qi and Jing territories."
